quote: Have faith have faith. When you have nothing else have faith.
author: Francine Rivers,  A Voice in the Wind

quote: Faith is believing in something you know isn't true.
author: Tom Robbins,  Half Asleep in Frog Pajamas

quote: Faith is the gaze of a soul upon a saving God.
author: A.W. Tozer

quote: Have faith in your beliefs
author: Michael Christos Zeis

quote: Faith is a place of mystery, where we find the courage to believe in what we cannot see and the strength to let go of our fear of uncertainty.
author: Brené Brown,  The Gifts of Imperfection: Let Go of Who You Think You're Supposed to Be and Embrace Who You Are

quote: Faith is an organ of knowledge, and love an organ of experience.
author: A.W. Tozer,  The Knowledge of the Holy

quote: Faith is not so much something we believe; faith is something we live.
author: Joseph B. Wirthlin

quote: Faith, in the sense in which I am here using the word, is the art of holding on to things your reason has once accepted, in spite of your changing moods.
author: C.S. Lewis,  Mere Christianity

quote: Faith is deliberate confidence in the character of God whose ways you may not understand at the time.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: Faith has to do with things that are not seen and hope with things that are not at hand.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: Faith is belief in what you cannot see or prove or touch. Faith is walking face-first and full-speed into the dark.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: Faith is simply whatever is real to us.
author: Elizabeth Kostova,  The Swan Thieves

quote: Faith is like radar that sees through the fog -- the reality of things at a distance that the human eye cannot see.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: Faith is realizing that you always get what you need.
author: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar,  Celebrating Silence: Excerpts from Five Years of Weekly Knowledge 1995-2000

quote: Faith is a knowledge within the heart, beyond the reach of proof.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Faith consists in believing what reason cannot.
author: Voltaire,  The Works: Voltaire

quote: Faith is why I'm here today and faith is why I made it through.
author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett,  Neglected But Undefeated: The Life Of A Boy Who Never Knew A Mother's Love

quote: Faith gives you an inner strength and a sense of balance and perspective in life.
author: Gregory Peck

quote: Faith is the cure that heals all troubles. Without faith there is no hope and no love. Faith comes before hope, and before love. (Sheikh Muhammad ibn Zaidi bani Tihama)
author: Paul Torday,  Salmon Fishing In The Yemen

quote: Faith in God includes Faith in God's timing.
author: Neal A. Maxwell

quote: To have faith is to be sure of the things we hope for, to be certain of the things we cannot see.
author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version

quote: Faith reveals the potential.
author: Toba Beta,  Master of Stupidity

quote: Faith is the flame that eliminates fear.
author: Suzy Kassem

quote: You develop faith by doing things that require faith.
author: John H. Groberg

quote: Faith activates God - Fear activates the Enemy.
author: Joel Osteen

quote: Faith in God is an opening up, a letting go, a deep trust, a free act of love - but sometimes it was so hard to love.
author: Yann Martel

quote: Faith is the great cop-out, the great excuse to evade the need to think and evaluate evidence. Faith is the belief in spite of, even perhaps because of, the lack of evidence.
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: Faith is the mortar that fills the cracks in the evidence and the gaps in the logic, and thus it is faith that keeps the whole terrible edifice of religious certainty still looming dangerously over our world.
author: Sam Harris,  The End of Faith: Religion, Terror, and the Future of Reason

quote: Faith to me is trusting in every evidence that something is―that it  is  possible, that it  is  significant, that it  is  real.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich,  Smile Anyway: Quotes, Verse, & Grumblings for Every Day of the Year

quote: Faith, n. Belief without evidence in what is told by one who speaks without knowledge, of things without parallel.
author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

quote: Faith is accepting what makes no sense, what we cannot prove, but know down deep in our souls is real.
author: Megan McCafferty,  Bumped

quote: Faith is like love: it does not let itself be forced.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Faith is not the belief that God will do what you want. It is the belief that God will do what is right.
author: Max Lucado,  He Still Moves Stones

quote: Faith is, at one and the same time, absolutely necessary and altogether impossible.
author: Stanisław Lem

quote: Faith is only as good as the one in whom it's invested.
author: Lee Strobel,  The Case for the Real Jesus: A Journalist Investigates Current Attacks on the Identity of Christ

quote: Faith is what makes life bearable, with all its tragedies and ambiguities and sudden, startling joys.
author: Madeleine L'Engle,  Walking on Water: Reflections on Faith and Art

quote: Believe, my child. Faith is the food of survival.
author: Tobsha Learner,  The Witch of Cologne

quote: Faith requires following the power of a whisper.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: Faith is the poetry of our dreams; action is the builder of our reality.
author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: We believe that faith is the cure that heals all troubles.
author: Paul Torday,  Salmon Fishing In The Yemen

quote: Faith: a device of the mind, fed by the soul, that functions like crutches to a man in a wheelchair.
author: Jarod Kintz,  The Days of Yay are Here! Wake Me Up When They're Over.

quote: A faith to live by, a self to live with, and a purpose to live for.
author: Bob Harrington

quote: Faith is about doing. You are how you act, not just how you believe.
author: Mitch Albom,  Have a Little Faith: a True Story

quote: Faith is a process of leaping into the abyss not on the basis of any certainty about where we shall land, but rather on the belief that we shall land.
author: Carter Heyward

quote: Faith in faith' he answered himself. 'It isn't necessary to have something to believe in. It's only necessary to believe that somewhere there's something worthy of belief.
author: Alfred Bester,  The Stars My Destination

quote: Faith is love taking the form of aspiration.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Faith is not simply a patience that passively suffers until the storm is past. Rather, it is a spirit that bears things - with resignations, yes, but above all, with blazing, serene hope.
author: Corazon Aquino

quote: You can’t give somebody faith. They either got it or they don’t.
author: Karen Marie Moning,  Iced

quote: Faith is the bird that feels the light and sings when the dawn is still dark.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Faith is not something to grasp, it is a state to grow into.
author: Mahatma Gandhi
